definition: lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people

sentences.english: Thank you for your understanding and tolerance, for one pair of Junior's love and concern.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢您的理解和包容，出于一个对小辈的爱护和关心。

sentences.english: I am nobody. Who are you?
sentences.chinese: 我是无名小辈，你是谁啊？

sentences.english: If the person they want is not there, we should first respond to the call.
sentences.chinese: 要是小辈要找的人不在，本身就先到小辈长远应对。

sentences.english: If the person they want is not there, we should first respond to the call.
sentences.chinese: 要是小辈要找的人不在，本身就先到小辈长远应对。

sentences.english: I am junior in Chemical Department.
sentences.chinese: 我是在化学制品部的小辈。

sentences.english: Train junior chefs and create new dishes for menu.
sentences.chinese: 训练小辈厨师并且创造新的盘为菜单。

definition: the younger generation/those who come after
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
smell of mother's milk not yet dried (idiom); immature and inexperienced/still wet behind the ears
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
